data.title: Fix a TypeError in direct.fsm.FSM
OpenMayaMac.h Removed
data.body: OpenMayaMac.h has been removed as it is no longer used. Customer's legacy projects must be updated to remove the use of the header file.

data.title: Add portable installers for Linux and Windows
Fix pmerge to work with Python 3
data.body: Python 3 uses `__lt__` and `__gt__` instead of `__cmp__`.

data.title: Fixed an issue in ServerRepository, where clients can send incomplete…
data.body: … packets and crash the server.

data.title: makepandacore: Add missing argument in exit reason
Remove useless "children" property of DistributedObjectBase
data.body: This property is not used and causes problems on the latest build.

data.title: Fix Python3 support
data.body: Another way to fix Python3 support. Only this PR or #106 should be accepted, but not both. #106 seems a bit nicer to me, but I don't know if it will work (i.e., support unicode) for Python2.

data.title: Fix Python3 support
Add DynamicHeightfield. Add properties to Bullet.
data.body:
Everything except BulletWheel is backwards compatible. I doubt the change there will affect many people. Up until now the API allowed setting steering in degrees on the BulletVehicle, or in radians on its BulletWheels. Now it's degrees in both cases.

BulletVehicle basic functions before (still works!):

```
self.vehicle.set_steering_value(steering, 0)
self.vehicle.set_brake(brake_force, 2)
self.vehicle.apply_engine_force(engine_force, 3)
```

Works now and may be future recommendation:

```
self.vehicle.wheels[0].steering = steering
self.vehicle.wheels[2].brake = brake_force
self.vehicle.wheels[3].engine_force = engine_force
```

data.title: Replace BulletSoftBodyMaterial camelCase methods
Remove obsolete heightfield_tex property from ShaderTerrainMesh
Support for R16I and R16UI
data.body: This adds Texture::F_r16i, to be used with T_unsigned_short and T_short. Internally GL_R16I and GL_R16UI is used.

data.title: Support for setting a heightfield handle directly on the ShaderTerrainMesh
data.body:
This patch allows setting the heightfield handle directly on the shader terrain mesh, instead of specifying a filename.

This makes the terrain more flexible, and also avoids having to copy the heightfield each time it changed.

The property `heightfield_filename` has been replaced with `heightfield`

data.title: Reduce warning severity when resizing texture with immutable storage
Fix several Sequence crashes
data.body: tuple and list shouldn't be used as parameter names. With the new Python 2.7.11 these break Sequences altogether.

data.title: Fix error "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable"
data.body:
filter(request, args) can return None, and in that case an error will be thrown.

The list() procedure is unnecessary, since if the filter returns a string, it will be wrapped into a tuple anyways.

data.title: bullet: Plug memory leaks
data.body: Signed-off-by: deflected deflected@github

data.title: Add missing "sys" import to ShowBaseGlobal
Fix missing coordinate system in sample
data.body: This adds `gl-coordinate-system default` to the shader terrain mesh sample to make the shader terrain works as expected. Otherwise the LOD is computed in a wrong way.

data.title: Match ShaderTerrainMesh triangulation scheme with Bullet's
Change uniform warning in glShaderContext to avoid spam
data.body: This changes the severity of the uniform warning to info, to avoid spamming the console

data.title: Merge pull request #2 from panda3d/master
data.body: update

data.title: Polygon polygon collision
data.body:
The surface point is imperfect, but the collision is able to consistently detect when two polygons intersect, and provide an accurate normal for the collision.
I haven't had performance issues, but there are some optimizations that could be made if we want to compare large polysets.

data.title: do not mutate dict we are iterating over
data.body: Risky at best, and actually raises an error on modern Python versions.

data.title: Add portable installers for Linux and Windows
data.body: NOTE: Windows is untested

data.title: Handle Python 2 vs Python 3 stdlib differences when building the morepy package
data.body: See PEP3108 for more details on stdlib differences. This has only been tested on Python 3.

data.title: automatically adapt panda3d render size to html5 canvas size presets
Add more properties to the Texture class
data.body: This PR adds more properties to the Texture class.

data.title: Add bulletHeightfieldShape constructor for use with ShaderTerrainMesh. Fix bulletHeightfieldShape to support non-square images.
data.body:
To use bulletHeightfieldShape's texture constructor with samples/shader-terrain/main.py:

``` python
"""
Bullet collision for ShaderTerrainMesh

Assumptions:
1) BulletWorld is self.BulletWorld and BulletWorld's NodePath is self.BulletWorldNP.
2) A 16bit grayscale image is used with STM (recommended).

N.B.: The Bullet Heightfield collision mesh will only match up correctly with the
ShaderTerrainMesh if the STM sample's vertex shader is used (and no tessellation
shaders)!
"""
from panda3d.bullet import BulletRigidBodyNode, BulletHeightfieldShape

stm_tex = self.terrain_node.get_heightfield_tex()
stm_pos = self.terrain.get_pos()
stm_scale = self.terrain.get_scale()

stm_coll = BulletHeightfieldShape(stm_tex, stm_scale.z)
# Should match the Panda3D config variable "stm-use-hexagonal-layout" (default is True)
stm_coll.set_use_diamond_subdivision(True)  # default is False
stm_t = BulletRigidBodyNode('stm_bullet')
stm_t.set_static(True)
stm_t.add_shape(stm_coll)
stmNP = self.BulletWorldNP.attach_new_node(stm_t)
stmNP.set_sx(stm_scale.x / stm_tex.get_x_size())
stmNP.set_sy(stm_scale.y / stm_tex.get_y_size())
stmNP.set_pos(stm_pos + stm_scale / 2)
self.BulletWorld.attach(stm_t)
```
